H.text: Peter Jennings was a high school dropout.
Peter Jennings was Canadian.
Peter Jennings died on Sunday August 7, 2005.
H.ref: Jennings, who announced in April that he had lung cancer, died Sunday at his New York home, ABC News President David Westin said in a statement.

H.text: Peter Jennings died at his home in New York.
H.ref: It was reported that he had died at his home in New York.

H.text: Peter Jennings died of lung cancer.
H.ref: Jennings _ who died of lung cancer Aug. 7 _ kept his looks to the end but was also "very, very smart," he said.

H.text: Peter Jennings died at the age of 67.
H.ref: ABC News anchor Peter Jennings died of lung cancer at the age of 67 on Sunday, his company said.

H.text: Peter Jennings died four months after he was diagnosed with lung cancer.
H.ref: Jennings -- who died at home in New York on Sunday night four months after he was diagnosed with lung cancer -- was hailed as a fiercely determined newsman who infused his broadcasts with a sophisticated sensibility honed by years as a foreign correspondent.

H.text: Peter Jennings delivered the news to Americans each night.
H.ref: Peter Jennings, the suave, Canadian-born broadcaster who delivered the news to Americans each night in five separate decades, died at age 67.

H.text: Peter Jennings was an ABC news anchor.
H.ref: At a music-filled memorial at Carnegie Hall, ABC News anchor Peter Jennings was remembered Tuesday as a journalist with a childlike awe of the world, a devoted father and loyal Canadian who always carried a copy of the U.S. Constitution.

H.text: Peter Jennings was the anchorman of ABC's evening newscast.
H.ref: Peter Jennings, the urbane anchorman of ABC's evening newscast for the past 22 years, died Sunday, it was announced by his network.

H.text: Peter Jennings was recalled during a service at Carnegie Hall.
H.ref: Peter Jennings, the ABC News anchor who died last month, was recalled as a devoted father, hard-driving journalist and a man who befriended homeless people, during a service at Carnegie Hall on Tuesday.

H.text: Peter Jennings became a household name in the United States.
H.ref: Peter Jennings, a Canadian-born high school dropout who became the face of ABC News and a household name in the United States, died of lung cancer Sunday at his home in New York.

H.text: Peter Jennings was remembered as a journalist with a childlike awe of the world.
H.ref: At a music-filled memorial at Carnegie Hall, ABC News anchor Peter Jennings was remembered Tuesday as a journalist with a childlike awe of the world, a devoted father and loyal Canadian who always carried a copy of the U.S. Constitution.

H.text: Peter Jennings was remembered as a devoted father.
H.ref: At a music-filled memorial at Carnegie Hall, ABC News anchor Peter Jennings was remembered Tuesday as a journalist with a childlike awe of the world, a devoted father and loyal Canadian who always carried a copy of the U.S. Constitution.

H.text: Peter Jennings was remembered as a loyal Canadian.
H.ref: At a music-filled memorial at Carnegie Hall, ABC News anchor Peter Jennings was remembered Tuesday as a journalist with a childlike awe of the world, a devoted father and loyal Canadian who always carried a copy of the U.S. Constitution.

H.text: Peter Jennings announced in April 2005 that he had a lung cancer.
H.ref: Jennings, who announced in April that he had lung cancer, died Sunday at his New York home, ABC News President David Westin said in a statement.

H.text: Peter Jennings always carried a copy of the US Constitution.
H.ref: At a music-filled memorial at Carnegie Hall, ABC News anchor Peter Jennings was remembered Tuesday as a journalist with a childlike awe of the world, a devoted father and loyal Canadian who always carried a copy of the U.S. Constitution.

H.text: Peter Jennings was hailed as a fierce newsman.
H.ref: Jennings -- who died at home in New York on Sunday night four months after he was diagnosed with lung cancer -- was hailed as a fiercely determined newsman who infused his broadcasts with a sophisticated sensibility honed by years as a foreign correspondent.

H.text: Peter Jennings was recalled as a hard-driving journalist.
H.ref: Peter Jennings, the ABC News anchor who died last month, was recalled as a devoted father, hard-driving journalist and a man who befriended homeless people, during a service at Carnegie Hall on Tuesday.

H.text: Peter Jennings was recalled as a man who befriends homeless people.
H.ref: Peter Jennings, the ABC News anchor who died last month, was recalled as a devoted father, hard-driving journalist and a man who befriended homeless people, during a service at Carnegie Hall on Tuesday.

H.text: David Westin is the ABC News President.
H.ref: Jennings, who announced in April that he had lung cancer, died Sunday at his New York home, ABC News President David Westin said in a statement.

H.text: David Westin said that Peter Jennings died Sunday August 7, 2005.
Peter Jennings' network announced Peter Jennings died Sunday August 7, 2005.
H.ref: Peter Jennings, the urbane anchorman of ABC's evening newscast for the past 22 years, died Sunday, it was announced by his network.

H.text: Peter Jennings was a smoker.
H.ref: Jennings' announcement four months ago that the longtime smoker would begin treatment for lung cancer came as a shock.

H.text: Peter Jennings transformed himself into a recognizable journalist.
H.ref: Peter Jennings, a high school dropout from Canada who transformed himself into one of the most urbane, well-traveled and recognizable journalists on American television, died Sunday.

H.text: Peter Jennings was diagnosed with lung cancer.
H.ref: Jennings -- who died at home in New York on Sunday night four months after he was diagnosed with lung cancer -- was hailed as a fiercely determined newsman who infused his broadcasts with a sophisticated sensibility honed by years as a foreign correspondent.

H.text: Peter Jennings began chemotherapy treatment.
H.ref: But after the anchor, a longtime smoker, learned he was fighting lung cancer in April, he immediately began chemotherapy.
